core.game

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • core.game.Game
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BasicGame, ForwardModel

    public abstract class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    Created with IntelliJ IDEA. User: Diego Date: 17/10/13 Time: 13:42 This is a Java port from Tom Schaul's VGDL - https://github.com/schaul/py-vgdl

    • Field Detail

      • humanPlayer

        public boolean[] humanPlayer
        indicates if player i is human or not

      • spriteOrder

        protected int[] spriteOrder
        z-level of sprite types (in case of overlap)

      • singletons

        protected boolean[] singletons
        Singletons of the game.

      • classConst

        protected Content[] classConst
        Content objects for the different sprite types.. The index is the type of object Content encloses information about the class of the object and its parameters.

      • parameters

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,ParameterContent> parameters
        Parameters for a Game Space. Unused in normal games.

      • templateSprites

        protected VGDLSprite[] templateSprites
        List of template sprites, one for each object in the above "classConst" array.

      • spriteGroups

        protected SpriteGroup[] spriteGroups
        Groups of sprites in the level. Each element of the array is a collection of sprites of a given type, which is also the index of the array.

      • collisionEffects

        protected java.util.ArrayList<Effect>[][] collisionEffects
        Relationships for collisions: double array of (list of) effects. Interaction between two sprites can trigger more than one effect. collisionEffects[] -> int id of the FIRST element taking part on the effects. collisionEffects[][] -> int id of the SECOND element taking part on the effects.

      • definedEffects

        protected java.util.ArrayList<Pair<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer>> definedEffects
        Pairs of all defined effects in the game.

      • eosEffects

        protected java.util.ArrayList<Effect>[] eosEffects
        List of EOS effects

      • timeEffects

        protected java.util.TreeSet<TimeEffect> timeEffects
        List of TIME effects

      • definedEOSEffects

        protected java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> definedEOSEffects
        List of types that can trigger an EOS effect.

      • historicEvents

        protected java.util.TreeSet<Event> historicEvents
        Historic of events related to the avatar happened during the game. The entries are ordered asc. by game step.

      • iSubTypes

        protected java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>[] iSubTypes
        For each entry, int identifier of sprite type, a list with all the itypes this sprite belongs to.

      • shieldedEffects

        protected java.util.ArrayList<Pair<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Long>>[] shieldedEffects
        For each entry, int identifier of sprite type, a list with all the itypes this sprite belongs to.

      • addSprite

        protected void addSprite(VGDLSprite sprite,
                         int itype)
        Adds a new sprite to the pool of sprites of the game. Increments the sprite counter and also modifies is_stochastic and the avatar accordingly.
        Parameters:
        sprite - the new sprite to add.
        itype - main int type of this sprite (leaf of the hierarchy of types).

      • runGame

        public double[] runGame(Player[] players,
                        int randomSeed)
        Runs a game, without graphics.
        Parameters:

      • playGame

        public double[] playGame(Player[] players,
                         int randomSeed,
                         boolean isHuman,
                         int humanID)
        Plays the game, graphics enabled.
        Parameters:
        players - Players that play this game.
        randomSeed - sampleRandom seed for the whole game.
        isHuman - indicates if a human is playing the game.
        humanID - ID of the human player
        Returns:
        the score of the game played.

                               int randomSeed,
                               boolean isHuman,
                               int humanID)

      • handleResult

        public double[] handleResult()
        Handles the result for the game, considering disqualifications. Prints the result (score, time and winner) and returns the score of the game. Default player ID used 0 for single player games.
        Returns:
        the result of the game.

      • checkTimeOut

        protected void checkTimeOut()
        Checks if the game must finish because of number of cycles played. This is a value stored in CompetitionParameters.MAX_TIMESTEPS. If the game is due to end, the winner is determined and the flag isEnded is set to true.

      • printResult

        public void printResult()
        Prints the result of the game, indicating the winner, the score and the number of game ticks played, in this order.

      • printLearningResult

        public void printLearningResult(int levelIdx,
                                boolean isValidation)
        Prints the result of the game, indicating the game id, level id, winner, the score and the number of game ticks played, in this order.

      • getFullResult

        public double[] getFullResult()
        Returns the complete result of the game (victory, score, timestep). Indicated in triplets, one per player.
        Returns:
        [w0,s0,t0,w1,s1,t1,...]

      • disqualify

        public void disqualify()
        Disqualifies the player in the game, and also sets the isEnded flag to true.

      • disqualify

        public void disqualify(int id)
        Overloaded method for multiplayer games. Same functionality as above.
        Parameters:
        id - - id of the player that was disqualified

      • abort

        public void abort()
        Aborts a game. Game is lost and game over.

      • createAvatars

        public void createAvatars(int humanID)
        Method to create the array of avatars from the sprites.

      • tick

        protected void tick()
        Performs one tick for the game: calling update(this) in all sprites. It follows the opposite order of the drawing order (inverse spriteOrder[]). Avatar is always updated first. Doesn't update disabled sprites.

      • eventHandling

        protected void eventHandling()
        Handles collisions and triggers events.

      • terminationHandling

        protected void terminationHandling()
        Handles termination conditions, for every termination defined in 'terminations' array.

      • clearAll

        protected void clearAll(ForwardModel fm)
        Deletes all the sprites killed in the previous step. Also, clears the array of collisions from the last step.
        Parameters:
        fm - Forward model where we are cleaning sprites.

      • addShield

        public void addShield(int type1,
                      int type2,
                      long functHash)
        Adds a new Shield effect to the scene.
        Parameters:
        type1 - Recipient of the effect (sprite ID)
        type2 - Second sprite ID
        functHash - Hash of the effect name to shield.

      • addSprite

                            Vector2d position)
        Adds a sprite given a content and position.
        Parameters:
        itype - integer that identifies the definition of the sprite to add
        position - where the sprite has to be placed.

      • addSprite

        public VGDLSprite addSprite(int itype,
                            Vector2d position,
                            boolean force)
        Adds a sprite given a content and position.
        Parameters:
        itype - integer that identifies the definition of the sprite to add
        position - where the sprite has to be placed.
        force - if true, ignores the singleton restrictions and creates it anyway.

      • addSprite

        public VGDLSprite addSprite(SpriteContent content,
                            Vector2d position,
                            int itype,
                            boolean force)
        Adds a sprite given a content and position. It checks for possible singletons.
        Parameters:
        content - definition of the sprite to add
        position - where the sprite has to be placed.
        itype - integer identifier of this type of sprite.
        force - If true, forces the creation ignoring singleton restrictions

      • killSprite

        public void killSprite(VGDLSprite sprite,
                       boolean transformed)
        Kills a given sprite, adding it to the list of sprites killed at this step.
        Parameters:
        sprite - the sprite to kill.
        transformed - - indicates if the sprite was transformed (necessary to kill sprite even if avatar, instead of disabling it).

      • getSpriteGroup

        public java.util.Iterator<VGDLSprite> getSpriteGroup(int spriteItype)
        Gets an iterator for the collection of sprites for a particular sprite type.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        sprite collection of the specified type.

      • getSubSpritesGroup
